pullRequests.title: SpeedTest 1.0.0
pullRequests.author: billyjbryant
pullRequests.body:
# SpeedTest Payload

## Description

Performs an internet speed test using speedtest-cli with optional loot file generation. Results are displayed via **ALERT** with geolocation information. Network metadata and test results can be saved to `/root/loot/speedtest/` based on user preference.

## Payloads

### [SpeedTest](library/user/general/SpeedTest/payload.sh)
Main payload that performs speed tests and optionally generates loot files.

### [SpeedTest_Config](library/user/general/SpeedTest_Config/payload.sh)
Configuration payload to toggle loot file generation setting.

## Features

- **Speed Testing**: Measures ping, download, and upload speeds using speedtest.net servers
- **Network Intelligence**: Captures SSID, local IP, public IP, geolocation (country, city, coordinates), and ISP information
- **Memory Optimized**: Uses `--no-pre-allocate` flag to prevent OOM kills on low-memory devices
- **Optional Loot Generation**: User can choose to enable/disable loot file generation (prompted on first run, configurable via SpeedTest_Config payload)
- **Results Display**: Shows speed test results with geolocation in an **ALERT** dialog upon completion
- **Persistent Configuration**: Loot generation preference stored using **CONFIG** (persists across firmware upgrades)

## Technical Details

- Automatically downloads speedtest-cli script if not present (single file, fast installation)
- Validates network connectivity before running tests
- Handles errors gracefully with **ERROR_DIALOG** for halting conditions

pullRequests.title: Feat Implement Hashlist Deduplication and Legacy API Support
pullRequests.author: panicacid
pullRequests.body:
## PR Title
feat: add hashlist deduplication and enhance legacy API compatibility

## Description
This Pull Request introduces significant improvements to the Hashtopolis Handshake Upload payload, focusing on resource efficiency and robust automation for Hashtopolis v0.14.6+ environments.

### Key Changes
- **Implemented MAC-Based Deduplication**: Added a pre-upload check that queries the Hashtopolis server for existing hashlists. The script now uses the Access Point's MAC address as a unique anchor to identify previously uploaded handshakes.
- **Introduced Skip Alerts**: Added a specialized notification system that alerts the user via the WiFi Pineapple UI when an upload is skipped due to a duplicate entry.
- **Legacy API Optimization**: Refined the API interaction logic to ensure full compatibility with the v1 User API (user.php), specifically addressing the "Task Wrapper" behavior found in older Hashtopolis builds.
- **Documentation Update**: Updated the `README.md` to reflect new version features and requirements.

### Why Submit This PR?
1. **Resource Efficiency**: Without deduplication, the Pager module can trigger multiple identical tasks for the same SSID. This wastes significant GPU cycles on cracking rigs by re-running the same attacks (e.g., 10-digit pin masks) multiple times.
2. **Bandwidth Savings**: Prevents redundant Base64 uploads of `.hc22000` files, which is critical for Pineapples operating on limited or metered mobile data connections.
3. **Improved UX**: The "SKIPPED" alert provides immediate feedback to the operator, confirming that the network is already being processed by the backend.

### Credits
Deduplication logic and skip-alert implementation contributed by **PanicAcid**.

---
**Version:** 1.1
**Testing:** Verified against Hashtopolis 0.14.6+repository.

pullRequests.title: Add Handshake Sanitiser utility for loot management
pullRequests.author: panicacid
pullRequests.body:
### Overview
This PR introduces the Handshake Sanitiser, a maintenance utility designed to manage the accumulation of redundant handshake captures and resolve filesystem compatibility issues with Windows.

### The Problem
Automated capture tools often generate dozens of duplicate .pcap and .22000 files for the same target BSSID/Client pairing. Furthermore, the standard naming convention uses colons ( : ), which are illegal characters on Windows filesystems, making loot export and analysis difficult for many users.

### Key Logic & Features
* **Suffix-Aware Deduplication**: The script identifies unique "events" by parsing MAC addresses and handshake types. It preserves the single newest file pair (.pcap/.22000) while purging historical duplicates.
* **Quality-Based Purging**: An optional logic gate allows users to purge 'partial' handshakes if a 'full' handshake for the same target is detected.
* **Windows Normalisation**: Iteratively replaces colons with hyphens across the directory to ensure OS compatibility.
* **Order Independence**: The utility is designed to handle files correctly regardless of whether they have already been renamed or deduplicated in previous runs.

### Testing Results
Successfully tested on hardware using a "real-world" loot directory containing 410 files.
* **Result**: Reduced clutter to 29 unique, high-quality captures.
* **Integrity**: Verified that the newest full handshakes were preserved and all colons were correctly sanitised for Windows export.

pullRequests.title: Refactor UpdateThemes to use Git
pullRequests.author: 0xchocolate
pullRequests.body:
Updated to use git for downloading themes instead of wget and unzip. Changed version from 1.4 to 2.0 and modified cache handling.

**Persistent effects of payload:**
1. opkg - installs git and git-http
2. storage - creates persistent directory /mmc/root/pager_update_cache

For users without git-http, this introduces a one-time setup of several minutes, but speeding up all theme updates after that. The additional time is from installing opkg dependencies (git, git-http).

**Timing seen in normal cases (stopwatch estimates):**
Previous version: at least ~90 seconds every time
This version (without git-http installed and without repo cloned): ~6 minutes for first time, ~20-35 seconds every time after that
This version (with git-http installed and without repo cloned): ~90 seconds for first time, ~20-35 seconds every time after that

These optimizations will be more useful over time as the theme repo grows. Currently the payload and ringtone repos do not have issues with the wget+unzip approach due to smaller file sizes but can be refactored similarly in the future if needed.

A dark, aggressive theme featuring hellhound fire aesthetics for the WiFi Pineapple Pager.

- **Hellhound fire boot animation** - 6 optimized frames with smooth transition
- **Fire gradient dashboard icons** - Custom skull icons with transparent backgrounds

# The Swiss Army Knife of Payloads for the Wifi Pineapple Pager! ðŸ

ðŸ‘‰**Includes more than 25 payloads out of the box!** See the [Included Payload Packs](#included-payload-packs-ðŸ“¦) section below for details.

Run payloads, keep track of results, export logs to Discord and more - all from the Pager interface!

## Video Review

[![Watch the video](https://i.ytimg.com/an_webp/45Wbnfh4HXc/mqdefault_6s.webp?du=3000&sqp=CJPBissG&rs=AOn4CLDxPLvPQ4tKHUSEZS-_4ZE2TRZ38g)](https://www.youtube.com/live/45Wbnfh4HXc?si=1Txkxtf60HLsgV7v&t=10148)

Watch Hak5's Darren Kitchen review MetaPayload and demonstrate its features on the Wifi Pineapple Pager: https://www.youtube.com/live/45Wbnfh4HXc?si=1Txkxtf60HLsgV7v&t=10148


## Get Started Easily ðŸš€
1. Install the metapayload directory as /root/payloads/user/metapayload
2. On the pager, Payloads > metapayload > Generate Payloads
3. Find generated payloads under Payloads > metapayload_recon

## Included Payload Packs

### ðŸ”­ MetaPayload Recon 
metapayload_recon.json includes a variety of reconnaissance-focused payloads powered by nmap and arp-scan.  These payloads provide everything from quick network discovery to comprehensive port scanning and service detection.

- **Quick Hosts Scan**: [TARGET_SUBNET]
- **ARP Network Scan**: [TARGET_SUBNET]
- **Top Ports Scan**: [TARGET_IP]
- **Full Port Scan**: [TARGET_IP]
- **UDP Port Scan**: [TARGET_IP]
- **Network Port Sweep**: [TARGET_SUBNET]
- **Network Web Sweep**: [TARGET_SUBNET]
- **Service Version Detection**: [TARGET_IP]
- **OS Detection**: [TARGET_IP]

###  ðŸ›  MetaPayload Sys Utils
metapayload_sysutils.json includes a set of essential system utility payloads for gathering system information, monitoring processes, managing files, etc

- **System Information**
- **Disk Usage (df)**
- **Process List (ps)**
- **Top Processes (top)**
- **Process Grep (pgrep)**
- **Network Connections (netstat)**
- **Find Files by Name (find)**
- **Find File Content (grep -r)**
- **Install Package (opkg)**

### ðŸ‘Š MetaPayload Wifi Attacks
metapayload_wifi_attacks.json includes a set of targeted Wifi Pineapple-focused attack payloads for authorized penetration testing engagements.

- **MP-WPS Brute Force (Reaver)**: Brute force WPS PIN attack (reaver) [Targets selected AP via Recon]
- **MP-WPS Pixie Dust (Reaver)**: Fast WPS Pixie Dust attack (reaver) [Targets selected AP via Recon]
- **MP-AP Deauth (aireplay-ng)**: Deauth Clients (aircrack-ng) [Targets selected AP via Recon]
- **MP-PMKID Capture (hcxdumptool)**: Aggressive PMKID capture using hcxdumptool [Targets selected AP via Recon]

pullRequests.title: A payload that configures external mediatek radios for pineapd to use in recon
pullRequests.author: Hunt-z
pullRequests.body:
# External MediaTek Radio Loader/Remover

A simple, robust payload for seamlessly managing external MediaTek USB Wi-Fi adapters on the WiFi Pineapple. It handles driver loading, configuration mirroring, and automatic cleanup.

### âš¡ Usage Instructions (Important)
You must run this payload **every time you change the physical state** of the adapter.

1.  **When you PLUG IN the adapter:**
    * Connect the USB adapter.
    * **Run this payload.**
    * *Result:* The script detects the device, loads the drivers, and mirrors your internal radio settings to the external one.

2.  **When you UNPLUG the adapter:**
    * Disconnect the USB adapter.
    * **Run this payload again.**
    * *Result:* The script detects the device is missing, safely disables the external interface configuration, and restarts PineAP to prevent errors.

---

### Requirements
* **Modern MediaTek Chipsets Only:** This script targets endpoint `.3`, which is the standard for modern dual-band chips (e.g., **MT7612U**, **MT7921 / AMD RZ608**).
* **Supported Drivers:** The device must have kernel support (`mt76`). Realtek and older chips are **not supported**.

### How it Works
1.  **Detection:** Checks the external USB bus (`1-1.1`) at interface `.3`.
2.  **Mirror Mode:**
    * **If found:** It loads the driver and reads the bands from your Internal Radio (`wlan1mon`). It then applies those same bands to the External Radio (`wlan2mon`), acting as a "helper" for hopping.
    * **If missing:** It disables the external radio config and restarts services to return to a clean state.
3.  **Safety:** It **never** overrides your Internal Radio settings.

### Troubleshooting
If the script runs but errors with **"Driver Failed to Load"**, your adapter is likely unsupported or requires a driver not present in the firmware. Unluckyâ€”it won't work.

pullRequests.title: Add Ringtone Previewer
pullRequests.author: billyjbryant
pullRequests.body:
# Add RTTTL Ringtone Previewer

## Summary

Adds an interactive web-based ringtone previewer that allows users to preview RTTTL ringtones directly in their browser before using them on their WiFi Pineapple Pager.

You can preview the ringtone previewer at https://billyjbryant.github.io/wifipineapplepager-ringtones/

## Features

- **RTTTL Parser & Player**: Full RTTTL format support with Web Audio API playback
- **Dark/Light Mode**: System preference detection with manual toggle
- **Search**: Filter ringtones by name
- **Playback Controls**: Play individual ringtones, play all, stop all
- **Volume Control**: Adjustable volume slider
- **File Support**: Works with both web (GitHub Pages) and local file:// protocol
- **GitHub Integration**: Ringtone titles link to their source files in the repository

## Changes

- Added `index.html` - Complete ringtone previewer web application
- Added `assets/pager-16bit.png` - Pager logo for header and favicon
- Updated `README.md` - Added links to the previewer in relevant sections

## Technical Details

- Pure HTML/CSS/JavaScript (no dependencies except Material Icons)
- RTTTL parser handles all note formats, durations, octaves, and BPM
- Accessible: Proper ARIA labels and semantic HTML
- Theme: Black/yellow color scheme with red accents matching Hak5 and WiFi Pineapple Pager branding

## GitHub Pages Configuration

> [!IMPORTANT]
> After merging this PR, GitHub Pages must be configured to enable the previewer

1. Go to repository [Settings â†’ Pages](https://github.com/hak5/wifipineapplepager-ringtones/settings/pages)
2. Under "Source", select "Deploy from a branch"
3. Choose branch: `master`
4. Choose folder: `/ (root)`
5. Click "Save"

Once configured, the previewer will be available at:
`https://hak5.github.io/wifipineapplepager-ringtones/`

## Preview

The previewer will be available at: `https://hak5.github.io/wifipineapplepager-ringtones/` after GitHub Pages is configured.

## Preview

The previewer is available at: `https://hak5.github.io/wifipineapplepager-ringtones/`

## Testing

- Tested in Chrome, Firefox, and Safari
- Works with both `file://` and `http://` protocols
- Dark/light mode switching works correctly
- All ringtones parse and play correctly
- Search and filtering work as expected

Introduces utility to verify public network identity and ensure active VPN/Proxy masking. Key features include:
- Dual API Redundancy: Seamlessly falls back from ip-api.com to ipinfo.io.
- Baseline Comparison: Allows users to save a "Baseline IP" and detects identity matches (e.g., marking home/lab networks).
- Interactive Dashboard: Native pager UI driven by physical buttons with real-time cache age timestamps.
- Developer API: Supports --check and --silent modes for integration  into other third-party payloads.
- Resource Efficient: Implements 60s local caching and strict timeouts to minimize data usage and battery drain.

Includes payload.sh and comprehensive README.md documentation.

pullRequests.title: feat: Quick Clone Pro - Persistent Evil Twin with SSID + MAC cloning
pullRequests.author: Aitema-gmbh
pullRequests.body:
## Summary

**Quick Clone Pro** is a powerful Evil Twin payload that provides persistent AP cloning directly from Recon mode.

### Features
- Clone SSID from any selected Access Point in Recon
- Clone MAC address (BSSID) for complete impersonation
- **Persistent configuration** using UCI - survives reboot!
- Changes visible in **Settings â†’ Open AP** menu
- Optional SSID Pool integration
- Backup/restore original configuration

### How It Works
Unlike basic SSID Pool cloning, Quick Clone Pro writes directly to `/etc/config/wireless` via UCI commands, making the configuration persistent and visible in the Pineapple's native menus.

### Workflow
```
Recon â†’ Select AP â†’ Run Quick Clone Pro â†’ Answer prompts â†’ Done!
```

### Technical Details
- Uses `uci set wireless.wlan0open.ssid` for SSID
- Uses `uci set wireless.wlan0open.macaddr` for MAC cloning
- Commits with `uci commit wireless`
- Applies with `wifi reload`

### Testing
- Tested on WiFi Pineapple Pager firmware
- Configuration persists after payload exit
- MAC spoofing verified with `iw dev wlan0open info`

### Category
`recon/access_point` - Designed to be run after selecting an AP in Recon mode.

pullRequests.title: feat: Add ALFA Range Extender for extended WiFi reconnaissance
pullRequests.author: Aitema-gmbh
pullRequests.body:
## Summary

Adds a new recon payload for using an external ALFA AWUS036ACH adapter with the WiFi Pineapple Pager. This enables significantly extended range WiFi reconnaissance using the adapter's high-gain antenna.

### New Payload

**Recon Payload: `recon/access_point/alfa-range-extender/`**
- Extends WiFi reconnaissance range with external ALFA adapter
- Auto-loads RTL8812AU kernel module
- Configures monitor mode with verification
- Dual-band support (2.4 GHz / 5 GHz)
- Optional automated airodump-ng scanning

### Features

- âœ… **Auto Driver Loading**: Attempts to load RTL8812AU kernel module
- âœ… **Monitor Mode Setup**: Configures adapter with verification
- âœ… **Band Selection**: User chooses 2.4 GHz (range) or 5 GHz (speed)
- âœ… **Automated Scanning**: airodump-ng with B button stop
- âœ… **Manual Mode**: Just setup, user does custom scan
- âœ… **Proper DuckyScript 3.0**: Correct CONFIRMATION_DIALOG handling
- âœ… **Cleanup Trap**: Kills scan process on exit
- âœ… **LED Feedback**: SETUP/ATTACK/FINISH/FAIL states
- âœ… **Loot Saving**: Results to `/root/loot/alfa-recon/`

### Hardware

pullRequests.title: feat: Add WPA-SEC integration for distributed WPA/WPA2 cracking
pullRequests.author: Aitema-gmbh
pullRequests.body:
## Summary

This PR adds two new payloads for integrating with [wpa-sec.stanev.org](https://wpa-sec.stanev.org), a free community-driven distributed WPA/WPA2 password cracking service.

### New Payloads

**1. Alert Payload: `alerts/handshake_captured/wpa-sec-upload/`**
- Automatically uploads handshakes to wpa-sec when captured
- Triggers on every handshake capture event
- Zero user interaction required after setup

**2. User Payload: `user/exfiltration/wpa-sec-tools/`**
- Interactive menu with 3 options:
  - Bulk Upload: Upload all existing handshakes at once
  - Check Results: View cracked passwords on Pager screen
  - Setup: Configure API key via Pager UI

### Features

- âœ… **BusyBox/OpenWrt Compatible**: No `grep -P` or GNU-specific flags
- âœ… **Smart Directory Scanning**: Finds handshakes in `/root/loot/handshakes/`, `/root/loot/dragonblood/`, and `/root/loot/archive/*/handshakes/`
- âœ… **PCAP Format Only**: Correctly handles wpa-sec's requirement for .pcap/.pcapng/.cap files (skips .22000)
- âœ… **Proper Response Parsing**: Detects success via hcxpcapngtool output patterns
- âœ… **Rate Limiting**: 0.5s delay between uploads to prevent server overload
- âœ… **Duplicate Detection**: Skips already-uploaded handshakes
- âœ… **Upload History**: CSV tracking with timestamps
- âœ… **Failed Upload Queue**: Saves failed uploads for retry
- âœ… **LED States**: Visual feedback (yellow=uploading, green=success, red=fail)
- âœ… **Vibration & Alerts**: Optional haptic and visual notifications
- âœ… **Global Config**: Shared config between alert and user payloads

### Files Added

```
library/
â”œâ”€â”€ alerts/
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ handshake_captured/
â”‚       â””â”€â”€ wpa-sec-upload/
â”‚           â”œâ”€â”€ payload.sh    # Auto-upload on capture
â”‚           â”œâ”€â”€ config.sh     # API key configuration
â”‚           â””â”€â”€ README.md     # Documentation
â””â”€â”€ user/
    â””â”€â”€ exfiltration/
        â””â”€â”€ wpa-sec-tools/
            â”œâ”€â”€ payload.sh    # Interactive menu
            â”œâ”€â”€ config.sh     # API key configuration
            â””â”€â”€ README.md     # Documentation
```

### Testing

Tested on WiFi Pineapple Pager with:
- âœ… Bulk upload of 36 handshakes
- âœ… Successfully retrieved cracked passwords
- âœ… BusyBox grep compatibility verified
- âœ… Archive directory scanning working
- âœ… Rate limiting functional

### What is wpa-sec.stanev.org?

[wpa-sec.stanev.org](https://wpa-sec.stanev.org) is a **free** distributed WPA/WPA2 cracking service where:
- Thousands of volunteer GPUs work together to crack passwords
- Massive wordlists and advanced rule-based attacks are used
- Users get notified when passwords are cracked
- No cost, community-driven

### Screenshots

The payloads display progress and results directly on the Pager screen:

```
==========================================
  WPA-SEC BULK UPLOAD
==========================================

Found: 15 PCAP files

[1/15] handshake_001.pcap
  OK
[2/15] handshake_002.pcap
  Skip (already uploaded)
...

==========================================
  UPLOAD COMPLETE
==========================================
Success: 12
Skipped: 2
Failed:  1
```

### Documentation

Comprehensive README.md files included with:
- Installation instructions
- Configuration guide
- Usage examples
- Workflow diagrams
- Troubleshooting guide
- API documentation
- Security & legal notes

pullRequests.title: Add Dropbox exfiltration payload with token authentication
pullRequests.author: macr0hack422
pullRequests.body:
## Summary
- Upload files/folders to Dropbox via API v2
- Access token authentication (no OAuth flow needed - Pager has no browser)
- Support for chunked uploads (>150MB files)
- Colorized menu system for easy navigation
- Upload history and session logging
- Auto-creates /Pineapple folder in Dropbox app folder

## Features
- **Simple Authentication**: Uses Dropbox's "Generated access token" feature - no OAuth flow needed
- **Multiple Upload Methods**: Handshakes directory, loot directory, custom files/directories
- **Progress Tracking**: Real-time upload progress with success/failure indicators
- **Session Logging**: Upload history stored in `/root/loot/dropbox_exfil/upload_sessions.log`
- **File Size Detection**: Multiple fallback methods for getting file sizes on different systems
- **Error Handling**: Comprehensive error messages and debug logging

## Setup
1. Create a Dropbox app at: https://www.dropbox.com/developers/apps
2. Select "Scoped App" â†’ "App Folder"
3. Enable permissions: `files.content.write` + `files.content.read`
4. Generate access token and use [DOWN] menu option to configure
5. Upload files to Dropbox with [UP] menu option

## Technical Details
- Uses Dropbox API v2 endpoints
- Chunked uploads for files >150MB (10MB chunks)
- Token validation before upload attempts
- Automatic folder creation in Dropbox
- Support for both simple and chunked upload methods

pullRequests.title: Add Dropbox Exfiltration Uploader Payload

## Summary
Adds a comprehensive Dropbox exfiltration payload that enables secure data exfiltration using the official Dropbox API v2 with OAuth2 authentication.

## Features
- **OAuth2 Authentication**: Secure token-based auth with app folder access
- **Token Management**: Automatic token refresh handling
- **Large File Support**: Chunked uploads for files >150MB
- **Directory Upload**: Recursive directory upload support
- **Optional Encryption**: AES-256 encryption before upload
- **Progress Tracking**: Real-time upload progress via Pager UI
- **Session Logging**: Detailed upload history and logs
- **Conflict Resolution**: Multiple strategies (rename/overwrite/skip)

## Technical Implementation
- Uses Dropbox API v2 endpoints (`api.dropboxapi.com`, `content.dropboxapi.com`)
- Implements proper OAuth2 flow with PKCE
- Handles file chunking for uploads >150MB
- Provides interactive setup via Pager UI (TEXT_PICKER, NUMBER_PICKER, PROMPT)
- Generates SHA-256 hashes for uploaded files
- Maintains upload session logs for audit trails

## Payload Structure
```
library/user/exfiltration/dropbox_upload/
â””â”€â”€ payload.sh (673 lines)
```

## Security Considerations
- No hardcoded tokens (operator must authorize via OAuth2 flow)
- App folder access limits scope to dedicated folder
- Optional AES-256 encryption for sensitive data
- Secure token storage with proper permissions

## Use Cases
- Remote data exfiltration during penetration tests
- Automated backup of captured evidence
- Secure transfer of sensitive loot files
- Cloud-based evidence preservation

## Author
@macr0hack422

pullRequests.title: Update: Refined log clarity and standard compliance for Client Accessâ€¦
pullRequests.author: panicacid
pullRequests.body:
### Overview
This update refines the Client Access Manager utility based on feedback to improve user guidance and align with repository standards.

### Changes
* **Enhanced Log Clarity**: Added specific instructions to the Pager log output to inform users that the payload functions as a toggle.
  * *Granted State*: Now displays `[*] Re-run payload to remove access.`
  * *Restricted State*: Now displays `[*] Re-run payload to re-enable access.`
* **Logic Integrity**: No changes were made to the core firewall automation or IP detection logic, ensuring the utility maintains its verified stability.

### Technical Implementation Recap
* **Targeted Firewall Exception**: Maintains a specific `ACCEPT` rule for the `wan` zone on TCP ports 22 and 1471.
* **Rule Prioritization**: Uses `uci reorder` to position the rule at Index 0, bypassing default system rejections.
* **Native UI**: Continues to utilize `CONFIRMATION_DIALOG` for seamless hardware interaction.

### Testing
Verified on hardware. The new log messages correctly guide the user through the toggle states, and the Pager successfully parses metadata from the script headers in the absence of the JSON manifest.

pullRequests.title: Add Client Access Manager utility for remote management over wlan0cli
pullRequests.author: panicacid
pullRequests.body:
### Overview
This utility provides a controlled mechanism for enabling/disabling administrative access (SSH and Web UI) over the Client WiFi (`wlan0cli`) interface. It is designed for developers and auditors who need to manage the Pager via a local network without the need to switch to the Management AP.

### Technical Implementation
* **Targeted Firewall Exception**: Defines a specific `ACCEPT` rule for the `wan` zone targeting TCP ports 22 and 1471.
* **Rule Prioritization**: Implements `uci reorder` to position the management rule at Index 0. This ensures the exception is processed before the system's default rejection rules.
* **Native Integration**: Utilizes the Pager's native `CONFIRMATION_DIALOG` system and `$DUCKYSCRIPT` environment variables for a consistent hardware experience.
* **Network Status Reporting**: Dynamically identifies the IPv4 address assigned to the `wlan0cli` interface and outputs the full management URL to the system log upon activation.
* **Configuration Integrity**: The revocation logic performs a complete deletion of the custom rule from the configuration and restarts the firewall service to restore the factory security state.

### Testing
Verified on hardware. The firewall reloads correctly, and the management interface becomes accessible via the Client IP immediately after confirmation. Access is revoked cleanly when the utility is run a second time.

pullRequests.title: Add payload for WPA handshake quality analysis and PCAP file organization
pullRequests.author: benwies
pullRequests.body:
This pull request introduces a new reconnaissance payload for the WiFi Pineapple Pager that focuses on post-processing and evaluating captured WPA handshake PCAP files.

It uses EAPOL frame detection to classify each capture and automatically organizes the results into structured output directories: VALID_FULL, PARTIAL, and INVALID. To maintain efficient repeated executions and clean storage, the payload detects and skips already processed handshakes using a simple hash-based mechanism.

The payload operates fully offline, does not require additional dependencies, and never modifies or deletes the original capture files.

pullRequests.title: Add multiple payloads (Handshake and PCAP stats for AP's and Clients + more)
pullRequests.author: Unit981
pullRequests.body:
This request will include 1 new **User Payload**, 2 new **Recon Payloads**, and 1 new **Alert Payload**.

The **User payload** will help present instant stats on:
1. Total Number of handshakes captured
2. Total Number of full handshakes (not partials)
3. Total Number of PCAP files
The stats appear in the log, but an Alert will pop up if full handshakes are found, with a reminder of where handshakes are stored.

The **Recon targeted payloads** are for AP and Client, when run on a target it will:
1. Clean the BSSID/MAC to make sure it's searchable
2. Finds any handshakes and pcap files matching the BSSID/MAC address of the Client or AP you targeted
Alert pop up with statistics.

The **Alert Payload** aims to reduce clutter and triggers upon capturing handshakes:
1. Check for duplicate handshakes (same method as above) for the AP MAC 
2. Alert when new unique handshakes are captured (like a new achievement)
3. currently set to drop the duplicate handshakes & associated PCAP's if there is more than 1 handshake already stored in loot
4. Alert when duplicated handshakes are captured, includes stats on handshake count
5. Alert again if deduplication lines are not commented out and handshakes are being dropped (lines 33-36)

pullRequests.title: Add Pager configuration payloads
pullRequests.author: PentestPlaybook
pullRequests.body:
## New Payloads

### Configure Evil Portal
**Location:** `library/user/general/configure_evil_portal/`

Automated installation and configuration of Evil Portal captive portal system for WiFi Pineapple Pager (OpenWrt 24.10.1).

**Features:**
- Complete PHP 8 + nginx + FastCGI setup
- Migrated from Mark VII (PHP 7 + iptables â†’ PHP 8 + nftables)
- Client whitelisting with background daemon
- UCI firewall configuration for boot persistence
- DNS spoofing on port 5353
- Automatic service management

---

### Configure Evil WPA
**Location:** `library/user/general/configure_evil_wpa/`

Automated configuration of the Evil WPA rogue access point interface.

**Features:**
- Configures Evil WPA interface
- Sets up network and DHCP
- UCI wireless configuration
- Boot persistence

---

### Configure PineAP Filters
**Location:** `library/user/general/configure_pineap_filters/`

Sets PineAP SSID and Client filters to deny mode.

**Features:**
- Sets SSID/Network filter to DENY mode
- Sets MAC/Client filter to DENY mode
- Commits changes for persistence
- Restarts PineAP daemon
- Verifies daemon restart

---

### Configure Wireless Client Mode
**Location:** `library/user/general/configure_wireless_client_mode/`

Configures the Pager's wireless interface to connect to an existing WiFi network as a client.

**Features:**
- Configures wireless client mode
- Sets SSID and authentication
- Automatic network connection
- Persistence across reboots

---

**Testing:**
All payloads tested on WiFi Pineapple Pager (OpenWrt 24.10.1)

**Credits:**
Evil Portal adapted from WiFi Pineapple Mark VII module

pullRequests.title: Requesting to add two payloads for SSID pool management
pullRequests.author: SkinnyRD
pullRequests.body:
StripOpenAP is a payload that strips out open access points from the recon.db file. The user specifies a filename to save the SSID list. Once complete the file is stored in /root/loot/pools. If the user does not specific a file, a default file name is given that designates the date and time.

AddSSIDFile is a payload that allows the user to upload a file into PineAP SSID pool. The file must reside in /root/loot/pools. Once run, the payload suggests a default file to upload that is the last modified file in the /root/loot/pools folder. The user is able to change that file name to any they deem appropriate.

pullRequests.title: Payloads for Installation and Management of Tailscale Services
pullRequests.author: JAKONL
pullRequests.body:
A fun weekend project to make Tailscale installation, configuration, and quick tasks a breeze from the pager native interface. 

One item I was hoping to get working but couldn't fit on the screen was a QR code for the tailscale authentication URL. 

_Appreciate any feedback!_

#### Implementation
The tailscale payloads help a user achieve common tasks in managing their Pineapple Pager's Tailscale services:
- Installation
- Authentication
- Get current tailscale IP address
- Service Start/Stop
- Uninstallation

#### Inspiration
I faced some challenges while onboarding my Pager to my Tailscale network. A non-comprehensive list includes:
- `opkg` Tailscale packages out of date (~ March 2024) with known security vulnerabilities
 ```
 root@pager:~/payloads/user/remote_access# opkg info tailscale
Package: tailscale
Version: 1.80.3-r1
```
- Managing `tailscale` connectivity with `opkg` installation requires shell
- Became confused as `uname -m` reports `mips` though the Pager requires packages built for `mipsel`

pullRequests.title: small user payload to upload to wigle on demand
pullRequests.author: marcdel
pullRequests.body:
this is currently blocked by a bug in WIGLE_UPLOAD. i made a bug report through the [form](https://shop.hak5.org/pages/pager-setup) but tl;dr: for anyone wanting to get this working now, WIGLE_UPLOAD tries read apiname, but WIGLE_LOGIN writes authname.

Modify this line in WIGLE_UPLOAD to use authname instead of apiname and it'll work
```
__apiname=$(PAYLOAD_GET_CONFIG wigle apiname)
```
